extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite of third year standing or above

basic.description: Through lectures, readings, and research, this course explores the nature, practice, and impact of photography in Canada between 1839 and 1939. By examining how the new medium was used to confirm, complement, and contest older forms of aesthetic expression, written documentation, or visual evidence, it traces the role of photography in Canadian society during this critical period of Canadian nation building.
basic.subject: ARTH
basic.title: Photography in Canada 1839-1939
